title: Honoring Calhoun High School senior Jenny Wu, upon the occasion of being named a Siemen s Competition semi-finalist award winner
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Calhoun  High School senior Jenny Wu,
upon the occasion of being named a  Siemen's  Competition  semi-finalist
award winner

WHEREAS,  It  is  the intent of this Legislative Body to commend and pay
tribute to those young people who, by achieving outstanding  success  in
educational competition, have inspired and brought pride to our majestic
Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Calhoun  High School senior Jenny Wu, upon the occasion of being named a
Siemen's Competition semi-finalist award winner; and
  WHEREAS, Jenny Wu, a Calhoun Senior, has been named a Siemen's  Compe-
tition  semi-finalist award winner for her science research work; she is
also the Class of 2011 Salutatorian, is  one  of  34  students  on  Long
Island, and one of the 312 national semifinalists; and
  WHEREAS,  An  estimated  one  out  of four deaths worldwide are cancer
related; one problem associated with conventional chemotherapy  is  that
the  drugs  cannot  differentiate between cancer cells and normal cells;
and
  WHEREAS, Jenny Wu did her research at SUNY Stony Brook in the  Depart-
ment of Chemistry; the abstract of her research is Synthesis, Biological
Evaluation,  and  Potential  Synergism  of  SB-T-1214  and  Topotecan in
Tumor-Targeting Drug Conjugates; and
  WHEREAS, As a volunteer in the emergency room at Mercy Medical  Center
in  Rockville  Centre, Jenny Wu has seen the agony of injury and disease
and, that is why she has decided to pursue a career in medical research,
focusing on pain management; and
  WHEREAS, Outside of science research, Jenny Wu plays tennis  and  runs
track  for  her  school;  she is a member of the Latin, Science and Math
clubs as well as the Student Council; she  lives  in  Merrick  with  her
parents,  Wendy  and  William,  along with her grandparents, Timothy and
Bonnie; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is moved to honor  Jenny  Wu,  an  able
scholar,  recognizing  the  value  of  her labors and the promise of her
future; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Calhoun  High  School senior Jenny Wu, upon the occasion of being
named a Siemen's Competition  semi-finalist  award  winner;  and  be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Jenny Wu.
